application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. As Google's products and services scale the globe, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future -- everything from underwater cables to physical data center space. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge of a given sector with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's infrastructure growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating deals, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting deal recommendations to our Tech leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to save Google millions of dollars in operating costs and impact every part of the business.

As a Data Center Acquisitions Strategic Negotiator, you will have a key role in helping to drive the team's overall location strategy, site selection, and portfolio management for Google’s owned and leased data center sites and related infrastructure. In particular, you will focus on forging new frameworks and providing the analytical support for Google’s global data center acquisition and site selection work.

In this role, you will work successfully across diverse circumstances, expectations, environments, cultures, paradigms and technologies. You are adept at strategizing, structuring, and analyzing a range of mission-critical transactions in diverse settings and with diverse parties, and will work on initiatives large and small, with only the support of small, focused teams. Additionally, you will plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks, and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business, Real Estate, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in a real estate acquisitions and/or investments role.
  • 2 years of experience with industrial or data center real state investment trusts (REITs) in acquisition, development, acquisition, or divestiture. Experience with wholesale colocation, and site selection for industrial and technology projects.
  • 2 years of experience negotiating colocation, data center, or network acquisitions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with the data center and colocation industry.
  • Experience of developing innovative agreements.
  • Experience and ability to comfortably work internationally.
  • Ability to learn new business and technical skills quickly and to adapt to changing environments.
  • Ability to adapt to changing business needs and handle multiple priorities with developed time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to travel at least 25% of the time as required.
responsibilities:
• Negotiate contracts to expand Google's Data Center leasing portfolio.
  • Devise and model complex analytical and quantitative scenarios, build pro-formas, and develop compelling executive presentations. Collaborate across broad stakeholder teams, working cross-functionally in a fast paced, ambiguous environment.
  • Identify, develop, and implement process/system improvements and drive continuous improvement and optimization.
  • Develop creative commercial and technical solutions, working independently and thinking dynamically in an ambiguous environment.
  • Develop strategic financing structures, project management from start to finish, and handle multiple priorities and complex projects simultaneously.
title: Strategic Negotiator, Data Center Acquisitions
